Pre-Game Insights: The New Orleans Pelicans travel to Washington on Sunday afternoon to face the Wizards for the second time in three days.
New Orleans finally ended their 11-game losing streak on Friday with a 132-120 win over Washington behind CJ McCollum's career 50-point performance.
Jose Alvarado returned to action for the first time since November, giving the team a major emotional boost.
Both teams released their injury reports for Sunday's matchup.
Zion Williamson (hamstring), Brandon Ingram (ankle), and Karlo Matkovic remain out on Sunday.
Dejounte Murray was questionable against the Wizards with elbow soreness, but is now available.
The Wizards list Saddiq Bey (knee) and Marvin Bagley III (knee) out for Sunday as they did for Friday, but guard Jordan Poole is listed as out.
Bilal Coulibaly is also questionable with a non-covid illness.
The tip-off for Sunday's game is at 5:00 p.m. CST.
